item.title: Divergent Technologies 在最新融资中获得 23 亿美元估值
item.description: Divergent Technologies 公司周一表示，该公司以 23 亿美元的估值筹集了 2.9 亿美元的资金，因为这家增材制造初创公司正在扩大规模，以满足国防客户日益增长的需求。【原文：Divergent Technologies said on Monday it has raised $290 million at a valuation of $2.3 billion, as the additive manufacturing startup scales up to meet growing demand from defense customers.】

item.title: 埃克森公司将提供自动投票以对抗股东激进主义
item.description: 埃克森美孚正在引入一种独特的股东投票机制，允许散户投资者在年会期间根据董事会的建议自动投票，此举可能有助于这家美国最大的石油生产商抵御激进主义运动。【原文：Exxon Mobil is introducing a unique shareholder voting mechanism that will allow retail investors to automatically cast ballots in step with board recommendations during annual meetings, a move that may help the top U.S. oil producer fend off activist campaigns.】

item.title: 加拿大人工智能公司 Cohere 在巴黎设立办事处，目标是在欧洲实现增长
item.description: 加拿大人工智能初创公司 Cohere 正在欧洲扩大业务，加剧了与法国 Mistral 等本土公司在该地区提供人工智能服务方面的竞争。【原文：Canadian AI startup Cohere is expanding operations in Europe, intensifying competition with homegrown players like France's Mistral to supply AI services in the region.】

item.title: Blackstone 将以约 10 亿美元收购宾夕法尼亚州发电厂
item.description: Blackstone 另类资产管理公司周一表示，将以近 10 亿美元的价格收购宾夕法尼亚州西部一座 620 兆瓦天然气发电厂 Hill Top Energy Center。【原文：Blackstone will buy Hill Top Energy Center, a 620-megawatt natural gas power plant in Western Pennsylvania, for nearly $1 billion, the alternative asset manager said on Monday.】

item.title: Alphabet 市值首次突破 3 万亿美元
item.description: 周一，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 的市值首次突破 3 万亿美元。【原文：Google-parent Alphabet hit a market capitalization of $3 trillion for the first time on Monday.】

item.title: 联合国专家弗朗西斯卡-阿尔巴内塞说：以色列试图让加沙城成为无法居住的地方
item.description: 联合国巴勒斯坦权利问题高级专家弗朗切斯卡-阿尔巴内塞说，以色列在进攻飞地最大的城区时，正试图让加沙城变得无法居住，并危及以色列人质的生命。【原文：The top U.N. expert on Palestinian rights, Francesca Albanese, said Israel was trying to make Gaza City unliveable in its assault on the enclave's largest urban area and was endangering the lives of Israeli hostages.】

item.title: 沙特金融科技初创企业塔玛拉（Tamara）获得高达 24 亿美元的融资交易
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯初创企业塔玛拉（Tamara）周一表示，已从包括高盛（Goldman Sachs）、花旗银行（Citi）和阿波罗基金（Apollo funds）在内的支持者那里获得了高达 24 亿美元的一揽子融资，这将有助于这家金融科技公司扩展其信贷和支付产品。【原文：Saudi Arabian start-up Tamara has secured an up to $2.4 billion financing package from backers including Goldman Sachs , Citi , and Apollo funds that will help the fintech company expand its credit and payment products, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 联邦贸易委员会起诉 Chegg 难以取消服务
item.description: 据周一在加利福尼亚州圣何塞提交的法庭文件显示，美国联邦贸易委员会起诉教育技术公司 Chegg Inc，称其难以取消订阅。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission sued educational technology company Chegg Inc for allegedly making it difficult to cancel subscriptions, according to court papers filed in San Jose, California on Monday.】

item.title: CoreWeave 与 Nvidia 签订价值 63 亿美元的云计算能力订单
item.description: CoreWeave 周一表示，它已与 Nvidia 签订了一份初始价值 63 亿美元的新订单，该订单保证 Nvidia 将购买任何未出售给客户的剩余云容量。【原文：CoreWeave said on Monday it had signed a new order with Nvidia with an initial value of $6.3 billion, which guarantees that Nvidia will purchase any residual cloud capacity not sold to customers.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司将在 2025 年底前停止在产品中使用玉米糖浆
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）周一表示，到 2025 年底，该公司将在美国停止在吉米-迪恩（Jimmy Dean）和希尔希农场（Hillshire Farm）肉类产品等品牌中使用高果糖玉米糖浆等特定成分。【原文：Tyson Foods on Monday said it will stop using certain ingredients, such as high-fructose corn syrup, in its brands, including Jimmy Dean and Hillshire Farm meat products, by the end of 2025 in the U.S.】

item.title: 高盛和 T. Rowe 将在年底前出售退休账户另类投资产品
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）和资产管理公司 T. Rowe Price 在本月早些时候宣布建立合作伙伴关系，这两家公司的高管告诉路透社，他们计划在今年年底之前为退休账户提供新的另类投资。【原文：Goldman Sachs and asset manager T. Rowe Price, which announced a partnership earlier this month, plan to offer new alternative investments for retirement accounts by the end of the year, their executives told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国贸易部长贝森特表示已就 TikTok 达成协议框架
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周一表示，在马德里与中方举行的贸易谈判中已就 TikTok 达成协议框架，这将为转为美国所有铺平道路。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Monday that a framework for a deal on TikTok had been reached in trade talks with the Chinese in Madrid, that would pave the way for a switch to US ownership.】

item.title: 特朗普在美联储会议前呼吁 "更大幅度 "降息
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一在社交媒体上发表文章，呼吁美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在美国央行本周召开会议之前 "更大幅度地 "下调基准利率，并将矛头指向房地产市场。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday called for Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell to enact a "bigger" cut to benchmark interest rates and pointed to the housing market in a social media post ahead of the U.S. central bank's meeting this week.】

item.title: Natura 将出售雅芳 CARD，探索雅芳国际的选择方案
item.description: 巴西化妆品公司 Natura 周一在一份证券文件中表示，该公司已就出售雅芳 CARD 签订了一份具有约束力的协议，并补充说，该公司将继续探索雅芳国际业务的战略替代方案。【原文：Brazil's cosmetic marker Natura has entered into a binding agreement to sell Avon CARD, the company said in a securities filing on Monday, adding it continues to explore strategic alternatives for Avon International business.】

item.title: 丹麦选择欧洲反导系统后，泰雷兹希望获得更多 SAMP/T 交易
item.description: 泰雷兹公司的一位高级主管说，在丹麦选择了法意防空系统而不是美国的 "爱国者 "之后，法国泰雷兹公司及其合作伙伴正在与几个欧洲国家和其他国家商谈潜在的新SAMP/T交易。【原文：France's Thales and its partners are talking to several European and other nations about potential new SAMP/T deals after Denmark picked the Franco-Italian air defence system over the U.S. Patriot, a senior Thales executive said.】

item.title: 据 Truth Social 发布的消息，特朗普暗示蒂克托协议已达成
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周一表示，与中国的贸易谈判进展顺利，并暗示已经达成协议，解决美国对 TikTok 所有权的问题。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday trade talks with China had gone very well and hinted that a deal has been reached to resolve issues the U.S. has over TikTok ownership.】

item.title: 特朗普称不应要求公司和企业提交季度报告
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周一推动美国证券交易委员会停止要求公司和企业提交季度收益报告，转而要求它们以六个月为基础提交报告。【原文：President Donald Trump on Monday pushed for the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to stop requiring quarterly earnings reports from companies and corporations and to have them report on a six-month basis instead.】

item.title: 马斯克收购电动汽车制造商价值 10 亿美元的股份后，特斯拉股价大涨
item.description: 在一份监管文件显示首席执行官埃隆-马斯克上周购买了这家电动汽车制造商价值近 10 亿美元的股票后，特斯拉股价在周一盘前交易中大涨约 8%。【原文：Tesla shares jumped about 8% in premarket trading on Monday after a regulatory filing showed that CEO Elon Musk had purchased nearly $1 billion worth of the electric-vehicle maker's stock last week.】

item.title: 之二 - 任何从我们的资产中转移的重大投资组合都可能是渐进的
item.description: 这是一条突发新闻。全面报道将很快发布。【原文：This is a breaking news story. Full coverage will be available soon.】

item.title: 诺华与 Monte Rosa Therapeutics 签订价值 57 亿美元的许可协议
item.description: 瑞士制药商诺华与药物开发商 Monte Rosa Therapeutics 周一签署了一项价值高达 57 亿美元的许可协议，共同开发治疗免疫介导疾病的药物。【原文：Swiss drugmaker Novartis and drug developer Monte Rosa Therapeutics signed a licensing deal worth up to $5.7 billion on Monday to develop drugs for immune-mediated diseases.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司因燃料成本影响，第三季度利润低于预期
item.description: 美国阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Air）周一表示，由于高燃油成本和运营挑战对利润率造成压力，该公司预计其季度利润将处于此前预期的低端。【原文：Alaska Air expects its quarterly profit to be at the low end of its previous forecast, as high fuel costs and operational challenges weigh on margins, the U.S. carrier said on Monday.】

item.title: 大卫-埃里森努力重建派拉蒙的内容大山
item.description: 在公司与派拉蒙的合并于今年 8 月结束后数小时，首席执行官大卫-埃里森（David Ellison）就开始了他的帝国建设。【原文：Hours after his company's merger with Paramount closed in August, CEO David Ellison's empire-building kicked into gear.】

item.title: 印度和美国将于周二在新德里举行贸易谈判
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对南亚国家的出口产品征收惩罚性关税数周后，印度和美国将于周二在新德里举行贸易谈判。【原文：India and the United States will hold trade talks in New Delhi on Tuesday, weeks after President Donald Trump imposed punitive tariffs on the South Asian nation's exports, slowing its overall shipments to a nine-month low in August.】

item.title: EchoStar 预计在出售频谱和偿还债务后将拥有 240 亿美元现金
item.description: EchoStar 周一表示，在利用频谱许可证销售收入偿还债务、增强资产负债表并支持无线、卫星和技术领域的增长后，预计将持有 241 亿美元的现金总额。【原文：EchoStar said on Monday it expects to hold $24.1 billion in total cash after using proceeds from its spectrum license sales to repay debt, bolstering its balance sheet and supporting growth in wireless, satellite and technology sectors.】

item.title: 解释：韩国为何不能与日本达成同样的美国贸易协议
item.description: 韩国与美国就降低关税的贸易协议进行的谈判陷入了僵局，原因是人们担心 3,500 亿美元投资基金的外汇影响，该基金是 7 月份与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普达成的协议的一部分。【原文：South Korea's negotiations with the U.S. on a trade deal to lower tariffs have stalled amid concerns over the foreign exchange implications of a $350 billion investment fund, part of an agreement reached with President Donald Trump in July.】

item.title: 美联储周开始
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 印度市场监管部门批准 Pine Labs 首次公开募股
item.description: 印度市场监管部门已批准金融科技公司 Pine Labs 的首次公开募股，其网站上的一份文件显示，该公司已于周一上市。【原文：India's markets regulator has approved the initial public offering of fintech firm Pine Labs , a document on its website showed on Monday.】

item.title: 英特尔下调全年支出目标
item.description: 英特尔公司周一表示，已将 2025 年全年调整后运营支出目标从之前的 170 亿美元下调至 168 亿美元，以反映其可编程芯片业务 Altera 的去合并化。【原文：Intel said on Monday it has lowered its full-year 2025 adjusted operating expense target to $16.8 billion, from $17 billion earlier, to reflect the deconsolidation of its programmable chip business, Altera.】

item.title: 美联储会议周伊始，华尔街期货走势低迷
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货走势平淡，为本周美联储恢复降息周期拉开了序幕。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were muted on Monday, kicking off a week where the Federal Reserve is expected to resume its interest rate cutting cycle.】

item.title: 遏制数十亿过度捕捞补贴的协议在世贸组织生效
item.description: 世界贸易组织表示，一项旨在遏制导致过度捕捞的数十亿美元补贴的具有里程碑意义的协议已于周一生效，活动人士称赞此举是朝着帮助全球鱼类种群恢复迈出的一步。【原文：A landmark agreement to curb billions of dollars in subsidies contributing to overfishing came into force on Monday, the World Trade Organization said - a move activists hailed as a step towards helping global fish stocks recover.】
